Description: Upper part of a female statuette; the lower part from above the knees missing. This belongs with other figures of the type, main glaze is off white, with hair, breast and horizontal stripe on hem of dress coloured black brown Arms extended the full length at the sides; back pillar horizontally pierced. Unusual in being clothed, and having fully modelled breasts.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Similar figurines in glazed composition, representing male and female in various postures, were discovered in Naukratis, especially in the sanctuaries of Apollo and Aphrodite.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (OM.26)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Museum of Fine Arts, Boston
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: P.5753 (Pottery & Porcelain Ledger No.)
